summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated November 2, 2020, transmitting two 2 TB hard drives containing data from the 'US v. Epstein (SW Returns)' Relativity database to an unspecified recipient. It demonstrates ongoing evidence handling in the Epstein case after his death.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the signatory of the letter, transmitting evidence hard drives related to the United States v. Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the subject of the criminal case referenced in the letter, 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein'.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the transmission of evidence from the case against Epstein.

events.title: Evidence Transmission
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmits two 2 TB hard drives containing data from the 'US v. Epstein (SW Returns)' database to an unspecified recipient.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated November 2, 2020, indicating post-mortem legal activity related to Jeffrey Epstein.
It references a 'US v. Epstein (SW Returns)' Relativity database, suggesting the data pertains to search warrant returns.
Two 2 TB hard drives of data were being transmitted, indicating a large volume of evidence.
The correspondence is from the U.S. Attorney's Office, showing federal involvement in evidence management.
Audrey Strauss was the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
